intro: Anthacantha desmetiana, commonly known as the Desmet's anthacantha, is a rare and elusive plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in damp woodlands. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive, aromatic scent when crushed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
